body.p:
GraySon Ky April 4th 1865
To His Excellency
Thos E. Bramlett
Dear Sir

In the Case of the Commonwealth of Kentucky against Squire Jones which was this day tried in the Carter Circuit Court the Jury Returned a verdict of Guilty and assessed the fine at fifty ^Dollars^ now there are many Considerations in our opinion for Executive interposition by Your Excellency not the least of them that the parties who prosecuted the Case against the Deft gave him much provocation to do what he did do The Deft Jones is a poor hard working man has a large family Dependant on him for a support

Respectfully yours
J. T. Shepherd DM
Geo. W. Crawford of the Jury
J. B. Ward " "
William Everman " "
S. L. Bays " "
J F. Meferen " "
Fleming Salmons
John N. Ford " "
Jas. W. Scott.
L. T. Whitlow
D. Tyree

p.note:
The facts stated in this petition I believe to be true
J. S. Dury, Comth Atty.
